documents.document: Kellyanne's current gig is just a curtain raiser for her future career in Nashville as a Country and Western singer.
Kellyanne Conway's current gig is just an interlude on her career path as a Country and Western singer.
@KellyannePolls I have a feeling that you don't believe a word you say but you're having the time of your life!
Are you sure the Bowling Green Massacre wasn't in an episode of Midsommer Murders?
I'm a bit of a snowflake over this 'Trump has small hands' business.
Good cartoon but I think it, or, rather, some healing force in response to it, can work.
It's extremely close, and inching closer: https://t.co/O39hQueOKK
Is this Fake News? When I put the same query to Bing, the response I get is totally different. How about trying itâ€¦ https://t.co/RxZulEO424
Apparently, human beings share 50% of our DNA with bananas. In the case of the Brexit voter on #bbcqt the percentage is considerably higher.
This is a resounding reply to supporters of the Corbyn line. And it's from Rotherham-Rotherham ! https://t.co/XctljU9kql
#bbcqt Panelists: Conservative Chairman and Editor of Conservative Woman. How come? And speaker from the Quilliam Foundation?????
2) The Labour Party's contribution to democracy is to represent its voters, so that all interests are fairly represented.
The Labour Party is not there to bow to the majority. Democracy is about the interplay of groups, opinions, and principles. (1)
3) The Border issue can be fudged now with vague promises but after Brexit, either there will be a border or not.
2) If there is no border with Eire, EU nationals will enter U.K. that way. But if there is a border, it will endanger the N.I. Agreement.
May is talking rubbish about Ireland. If we are to be in control of our borders, we will have to have one with Eire. (1)
Many felt Ken Clarke made the best anti-war speech on Iraq. Now he has made the best speech on Brexit. No real answers to his Brexit speech.
It has been said that, when Labour and the Conservatives unite, it is on a calamitous policy: Iraq, Afghanistan and now Brexit.
How can it be 'democracy' when Labour fails to represent the views of the left-leaning, most of its own supporters, and those under 50?
@marthasydenham In a democracy, you have an opposition which, by definition, has a licence to oppose, surely?
@lukeakehurst @EllieCumbo As a therapist, I believe that people have a right to change their minds-don't you believe that too?
@lukeakehurst @EllieCumbo Surely a party is a means to an end, the end being concerned with policies and principles?
@JonDennis @lloydshep Farage, as you rightly imply, is the real enemy of democracy. What sort of democrat wants no opposition?
@LabourEoin Yes, but not because they had suddenly discovered that they respected his leadership.
By that time, it may be too late. Labour needs to vote now on the likely outcome. https://t.co/njavt00NuP
One of the Labour amendments-asking for a final vote-has surely already been granted by May? And useless if Labour acts cravenly again.
@melaniekmelvin @catethetwaate @jeremycorbyn No, it's not. It's his Euroscepticism and crude electoral calculation.
Labour has taken its most important decision since World War 2 on the basis of Corbyn's Euroscepticism and crude electoral calculation.
This shows how intelligent analysts see the most important decision since World War Two. The https://t.co/fvQW0FwVyw
A-level History exam question, 2040. 'Why, when they knew it was disastrous, did MPs vote for a departure from the EU?'
Not just trade deals, but everything about Brexit is 'Alice in Wonderland.' Brexiteers will shift the blame when the truth is revealed.
@notwaving I once had a conversation with Lulu at a dentists. 'She looked like Lulu, I said.' 'Because she is, ' the receptionist replied.
@PrisonPlanet I have taught English in a predominantly Muslim area. The children and their parents were largely delightful and admirable.
@SocialistVoice @KittieCreighton @LabourEoin UKIP is now on about 14%. The real threat is that Labour Remain voters will abstain.
@LabourEoin @Carolynoflondon A strange argument. If some members of the Opposition do some opposing.....
@mtpennycook @franceshinde What is already encouraging the far right is yoking ourselves to the whims of a mad President. Brexit emboldens.
@mtpennycook @franceshinde When Brexit seen as huge mistake, Conservatives will say "You voted for it."
@mtpennycook @franceshinde Lab. failed to argue strongly it wasn't to blame for crash, now accepted as truth. Repeating this mistake.
@mtpennycook @franceshinde Craven. Case that losing side surrenders its democratic rt.to oppose would have been rejected by Leave.
@BirgittaHeiller If Labour was in power, and had promised to implement the Referendum. But, if there is no opposition, there is no democracy
@LukeBurstow @AmiableNoodle Yes, he found that really hard. For him, the arguments are clearly evenly balanced.
Don't you wish you were as articulate as Trump? And could match his moral clarity? https://t.co/gy3LBQ7ZVE
This is why Stella Creasey should lead Labour! https://t.co/bOEFrJz8zy
If you thought #BBCR4today was biased this morning, wait until Sarah Sands becomes its editor.
Last week, I suggested Stella Creasey should be the next Labour leader. And after her fiery performance on #Newsnight I'm convinced.
As the mosque terrorist turned out to be a Trump supporter, it would make sense to ban all Trump supporters. #trumplogic
@politicshome Hasn't the US embassy denied that story?
Now it has become clear what the alternatives are, Labour needs an urgent re-think. It's not a democracy if there is no opposition.
Now clear that a trading nation has to make alliances and compromises. Do we do this with our neighbours or with Trump and Turkey?
Will Teresa May declare that no deal is better than a bad deal with Trump?
@LeaveEUOfficial Why is Nigel Farage all over the BBC? Why not Tim Farron? Or AC Grayling? Why the preference for the Right?
@Rachael_Swindon But isn't this a misunderstanding of democracy? You should always campaign for your beliefs and principles.
@PrisonPlanet Disgusting slur on a courageous man. Much admired in London.
@PrisonPlanet That's what happens in Britain at Conferences. You share a platform with your opponents. Khan always anti-terrorist.
The Cabinet Office Code of Practice specifies a MINIMUM of 12 weeks' consultation before a Bill is introduced to the Commons. EU Bill????
If people realised that Brexit is hitting their living standards, they would turn against it. The BBC is failing to tell the truth.
BBC website leads on the Resolution Foundation report on wage and price trends. The report emphasises Brexit. The BBC makes no mention of it
If Trump visits London, the march against him will dwarf even that against the Iraq War.
Prince Charles can be outspoken. Cannot believe that, with his multi-faith convictions, he could favour the Muslim ban. Hope he speaks out.
The Queen has nothing to loose. It would be wonderful if she spoke out against Trump.
If the London Mayor cannot visit America, Trump should not be welcomed in London.
3) How welcome will Muslims feel in Britain if the British Prime Minister is supportive of racism against their co-religionists?
2) As there are over 3 million Muslims in Britain, it is for the government to represent their interests.
1) Of course, you can comment on other countries' immigration policies. India and Australia have said they want access to Britain !
This is the news of the century: China thinking of going to war with America. https://t.co/LwR4uw4aV1
@KellyannePolls A man of action, for sure. A man who forgets that you are supposed to think before you act.
@bbclaurak did exactly this. Full credit to her and to the BBC. https://t.co/JxFClmXEvo
One of the Leave campaigns favourite scare stories was about Turkey joining the EU. Now Mrs. May goes there to discuss a trade deal.
@christoclifford The three line whip to vote for the motion. That is why he has faced opposition and resignations.
@christoclifford Not if you say you are going to vote for the Bill anyway even if the amendments are lost.
@liamyoung @JoyMillward Because the phrase is a trick! About half the electorate, including the Labour supporting half, willed otherwise.
Excellent news. Shows principles and character: https://t.co/wxCCV6r2Dd
This is a principled decision, and let us hope it will encourage others to do the same: https://t.co/bc7uNejwoH
Nothing could be as excruciating as Corbyn evading a question. https://t.co/RNJ7G1lBxs
@Keir_Starmer What's the point? If Labour gives May carte blanche now, why believe you would not rubber stamp later?
@christoclifford Or you could try standing up for your principles and the good of the country?
@christoclifford Isn't there a party called the Libdems?
Taking back control. Closing our borders to NHS workers. Opening our borders to US private health companies taking over the NHS.
@jeremycorbyn And using a three line whip to make your MPs vote for it is a great way to achieve this objective?
This is what intelligence looks like as it defines what madness looks like: https://t.co/JSIaSjqpox
@JeremyCorbyn4PM Nor do it vote for Labour to support the Tories to make it happen!
@djhiom It is liberal in that the Libdems see the EU as representing Free Trade and democratic in that they give voice to the 48%.
May 's section on Russia was extremely clever. It appears to agree with Trump while steering him away from isolationism. A wise strategy.
Trying to avoid history repeating itself is essential. The task now, however, is to reach beyond partisanship to show that Trump is mad.
@PrisonPlanet Because he's mad. The man with his finger on the nuclear trigger is mad.
@robbeardmore7 In the North, there aren't a lot of bicycling bearded, pacifist, non-drinking vegetarians either. And not just in the North.
@Opensout True but the SNP would work with an anti-Brexit Labour Party.
@Opensout In the Sleaford election, UKIP declined by about 14%. Where is the evidence for UKIP growth?
@robbeardmore7 It would be a good start to have a leader who appeals to anybody (activists apart). Warmth, humanity, humour liked everywhere
@Opensout But their support is now showing a half of what it was at the time of the Referendum.
@robbeardmore7 I like Stella Creasey. She talks human and is good on TV. She would contrast very favourably with May.
@Opensout Some sensational newspaper polls in the north have suggested that in industrial areas, opinion has changed dramatically
@Opensout I The 25% of Labour supporters who are neutral or pro-Brexit won't desert the party, given how right wing its opponents are.
@robbeardmore7 The world has moved on. It's now Trump versus the NHS. With a half decent leader, the case can be decisively won.
@cutter78 2) Argue that people have a right to change their minds. Refuse as a party to endorse a bad deal.
@cutter78 Start by asserting the democratic right to oppose. Offer a clear line. Publicise the facts. (1)
@Opensout How is betraying their own supporters going to help the Party? It is like McDonald forming the National Government.
Trump promised to build a wall a thousand miles long. As the Mexican border runs for 2 thousand miles, perhaps he overrates his smartness.
@cutter78 It's the Labour leadership that is destroying the party. And supporting a policy that will destroy Britain.
@Opensout But not the Labour supporters in those constituencies. Labour has a right to represent the 48%.
